title: Markup/Margin Settings - Combined or Separate for Labor and Materials
description:
## Overview
Allow tenant to choose whether markup/margin applies to labor and materials together or separately. This is a company-level setting configured during initial setup or in Company Settings.

## Location
Settings → Pricing & Billing → Markup Configuration

## UI Design

### Markup Method Selector
```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ MARKUP/MARGIN APPLICATION                                   │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                             │
│  How do you apply markup to your pricing?                   │
│                                                             │
│  ○ Combined (Single rate for all costs)                     │
│    Overall Markup: ______%  OR  Margin: ______%             │
│    Applied to: Labor + Materials + Equipment                │
│                                                             │
│  ● Separate (Different rates by cost type)                  │
│    Material Markup: ______%  OR  Margin: ______%            │
│    Labor Markup: ______%  OR  Margin: ______%               │
│    Equipment Markup: ______%  OR  Margin: ______%           │
│    Subcontractor Markup: ______%  OR  Margin: ______%       │
│                                                             │
│  Input Mode: ○ Markup  ● Margin  [?] What's the difference  │
│                                                             │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Educational Tooltip
```
MARKUP vs MARGIN

Markup: Percentage added ON TOP of cost
  Cost $100 + 35% markup = $135 sell price

Margin: Percentage of sell price that is profit  
  $100 cost at 25% margin = $133.33 sell price
  (Profit is 25% of $133.33 = $33.33)

Conversion:
  Margin = Markup ÷ (1 + Markup)
  Markup = Margin ÷ (1 - Margin)
```

## Database Fields (tenant_settings)
- markup_mode ENUM ('combined', 'separate') DEFAULT 'separate'
- input_mode ENUM ('markup', 'margin') DEFAULT 'markup'

### Combined Mode
- combined_markup DECIMAL (e.g., 0.40 = 40%)

### Separate Mode (existing fields, ensure present)
- markup_material DECIMAL DEFAULT 0.35
- markup_labor DECIMAL DEFAULT 0.50
- markup_equipment DECIMAL DEFAULT 0.30
- markup_subcontractor DECIMAL DEFAULT 0.15

## Initial Setup Integration
Add this question to the initial company setup wizard if one exists, or create a first-run configuration modal.

## Files to Modify
- apps/api/migrations/043_markup_mode_settings.sql
- apps/web/src/components/Settings/PricingBillingSettings.jsx
- apps/api/src/services/pricing.service.js (apply correct mode)
close_reason: Implemented Combined vs Separate markup/margin mode with migration 053, updated UI in PricingBillingSettings.jsx, and calculation service. Commit c2086544.

title: Change Order Request Flow from Field
description:
## Summary
Tech on-site discovers additional work needed. Uses Actions system to request change order from back office.

## Components
1. One-time warning per WO - Reminder that tasks are not for additional work
2. Request Change Order button - Creates Action of type CHANGE_ORDER_REQUEST
3. Action linked to WO - Sales/dispatch sees in dashboard
4. Client approval flow - Email to client for confirmation
5. Resolution options: Schedule for later OR create on-spot and assign to tech

## Action Fields
- Type: CHANGE_ORDER_REQUEST
- Source: field/mobile
- Linked entity: work_order
- Description: Tech description of additional work needed
- Priority: HIGH (tech is on-site waiting)

## Flow
Tech -> Request Change Order -> Action created -> Sales/Dispatch notified -> Client email -> Approval -> Change order created -> Scheduled or assigned

## Rules
- Tasks are for checklist items only, not additional work
- Additional work requires change order
- Client must confirm before work can be scheduled/assigned
- Estimate ceiling enforced - change order updates the ceiling
close_reason: All 5 components implemented: warning banner, request button, dashboard, email approval, resolution options

title: Labor Cost Calculator - Reference Tool with Disclaimer
description:
## Overview
Add a Soft Cost Calculator page that helps tenants determine their blended labor rate. This is a REFERENCE TOOL that feeds into the standard labor settings.

## Location
Navigation: PRICING section → 💰 Labor Costs

## UI Components

### 1. Employee Roster Table (editable)
- Columns: Role/Name, Annual Salary, Calculated Total Cost
- Total Cost = Salary × (1 + burden_multiplier)
- Add/Remove employee buttons
- Common presets: Tech Level 1/2/3, Service Manager, Admin Support

### 2. Settings Section
- Burden Multiplier % input (default 35%)
  - Tooltip: Includes payroll taxes, workers comp, benefits, PTO
- Utilization Rate % input (default 80%)
  - Tooltip: Percentage of work hours that are billable

### 3. Hours Per Unit Section (optional, for per-unit pricing)
- Editable inputs for common unit types
- Trades examples: per outlet, per panel, per 100ft conduit

### 4. Calculated Results Display (read-only, live updates)
- Total Employees
- Total Annual Labor Cost
- Blended Annual Salary
- Billable Hours (2080 × utilization_rate)
- **Blended Hourly Rate** (key output)
- Soft Cost per Unit (if hours_per_unit configured)

### 5. Action Buttons
- 'Apply to Labor Settings' → copies blended rate to tenant settings
- 'Save Calculator Data' → persists employee roster for future reference
- 'Reset to Defaults' → clears to starting values

## Disclaimer (REQUIRED - display prominently)
```
⚠️ REFERENCE CALCULATOR ONLY

This calculator is provided as a planning tool to help estimate labor costs.
Results are for informational purposes only and do not constitute financial,
legal, or accounting advice.

Before making business decisions based on these calculations, consult with
a qualified CPA, CFO, or financial advisor who understands your specific
business circumstances, tax obligations, and regulatory requirements.
```

## Data Model
```json
{
  "employees": [
    { "role": "Tech Level 2", "salary": 52000 },
    { "role": "Tech Level 1", "salary": 33280 }
  ],
  "burden_multiplier": 0.35,
  "utilization_rate": 0.80,
  "hours_per_unit": {}
}
```

## Formulas
1. Total Annual Labor Cost = Σ(salary × (1 + burden_multiplier))
2. Blended Annual Salary = Total Annual Labor Cost ÷ employee_count
3. Billable Hours = 2080 × utilization_rate
4. Blended Hourly Rate = Blended Annual Salary ÷ Billable Hours

## Files to Create/Modify
- apps/web/src/pages/pricing/LaborCostCalculator.jsx (new)
- apps/web/src/nav/appNav.js (add nav item)
- apps/api/src/routes/laborCalculator.routes.js (persist data)
- apps/api/migrations/043_labor_calculator_data.sql (storage)
close_reason: Implemented all required features: disclaimer, reset button, hours per unit section

title: Cost Item AI Search Service (OpenAI Embeddings)
description:
## Overview
Implement AI-powered cost item search using OpenAI embeddings for natural language matching.

## Requirements
- Generate embeddings for cost items using text-embedding-3-small
- Store embeddings in pgvector column
- Search by semantic similarity
- Fallback to text search if pgvector unavailable
- Context boosting (area type, category, recent usage)
- Record search selections for learning
- Handle new item requests when no match found

## Key Files
- apps/api/src/services/ai/costItemSearch.service.js (CREATE)
- apps/api/src/routes/ai.routes.js (MODIFY)

## API Endpoints
POST /api/ai/cost-item-search        - Search cost items by natural language
POST /api/ai/cost-item-search/select - Record selection for learning
POST /api/ai/new-cost-item-request   - Request new item when not found

## Dependencies
- OpenAI API key configured
- pgvector extension (optional, graceful fallback)
- co-np5 (Cost Item CRUD Service)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Natural language queries return relevant results
- 'half inch bbc elbow' matches appropriate cost item
- Top results ranked by relevance
- Selection tracking improves future results

title: AI: Procurement Invoice OCR & Inventory
description:
AI-powered invoice processing with OCR and inventory management.

## Features: invoice_ocr, invoice_processing, inventory_matching, po_reconciliation, cost_averaging

## Workflow

### 1. Invoice OCR (invoice_ocr)
- Upload scanned invoice image/PDF
- Claude Vision extracts:
  - Vendor name and info
  - Invoice number and date
  - Line items (description, qty, unit price, total)
  - Tax, shipping, total
- Returns structured JSON

### 2. Invoice Processing (invoice_processing)
- Parse OCR output into inventory transactions
- Validate totals match
- Flag discrepancies for review

### 3. Inventory Matching (inventory_matching)
- Match invoice line items to existing inventory SKUs
- Fuzzy matching for vendor part numbers
- Suggest new SKU creation for unknown items
- Handle unit of measure conversions

### 4. PO Reconciliation (po_reconciliation)
- Match invoice to open purchase orders
- Flag quantity/price discrepancies
- Support partial receipts
- Track backorders

### 5. Cost Averaging (cost_averaging)
- Calculate weighted average cost:
  existing_qty * existing_cost + new_qty * new_cost / total_qty
- Update inventory item cost
- Track cost history for reporting

## API
- POST /api/ai/invoice-ocr - Upload and extract invoice
- POST /api/ai/match-invoice-items - Match to inventory
- POST /api/ai/reconcile-po - Match to PO
- GET /api/inventory/:id/cost-history - View cost changes

## Reports
- When was item X last received?
- What was the price history?
- Average cost over time
- Vendor price comparison

## Token Usage
- Invoice OCR uses Claude Vision: ~10-20K tokens per image
- Pro plan has 2M tokens/month to accommodate

title: AI: Smart Dispatch Scheduling
description:
AI-powered dispatch scheduling and optimization.

## Features: smart_scheduling, schedule_optimization

## Capabilities

### smart_scheduling
- Suggest optimal technician for a work order based on:
  - Skills/certifications required
  - Current location/route
  - Existing schedule gaps
  - Customer preferences
  - Work order priority

### schedule_optimization
- Optimize daily/weekly schedule:
  - Minimize drive time between jobs
  - Balance workload across technicians
  - Respect time windows and SLAs
  - Handle multi-day jobs
  - Account for LAB2+ crew requirements

## AI Prompt Considerations
- Include technician skill matrix
- Consider traffic patterns by time of day
- Factor in job duration estimates from labor hours
- Handle emergency/urgent prioritization

## API
- POST /api/ai/suggest-technician - Best tech for a WO
- POST /api/ai/optimize-schedule - Optimize day's schedule
- POST /api/ai/rebalance-routes - Rebalance after changes

## Data Needed
- Technician locations (GPS)
- Skill certifications
- Current schedule
- Work order requirements
- Historical job durations

title: Bug: S5 useEffect dependency missing searchParams
description:
## Bug Description
In ConvertToWorkOrderPage.jsx, the main data-fetching useEffect (line 124-126) has `[estimateId]` as its dependency array.

However, the estimate ID can also come from URL search params (line 140):
```js
const estId = estimateId || searchParams.get('estimate');
```

If the user navigates using `?estimate=xxx` search param instead of the route param, and the search param changes, the effect will NOT re-run.

## Location
apps/web/src/pages/salesops/ConvertToWorkOrderPage.jsx:124-126

## Impact
Low - Most users navigate via route params, but this could cause stale data if using search params.

## Suggested Fix
Add `searchParams` to the dependency array:
```js
useEffect(() => {
  fetchData();
}, [estimateId, searchParams]);
```

Or use a memoized estimate ID:
```js
const estId = useMemo(() => estimateId || searchParams.get('estimate'), [estimateId, searchParams]);
```
close_reason: Fixed by adding searchParams to useEffect dependency array

title: Labor Rate Settings - Simple vs Advanced Toggle
description:
## Overview
Add labor rate configuration to Company Settings with two methods:
- Simple: Direct entry or burden component calculation
- Advanced: Link to Soft Cost Calculator

## Location
Settings → Company Preferences → Labor Rate Configuration

## UI Design

### Method Selector
```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ LABOR COST METHOD                                           │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                             │
│  ● Simple (Recommended for most contractors)                │
│    ○ Direct Entry: $______/hr fully-loaded                  │
│    ○ Calculate from Components:                             │
│      Base Wage: $______/hr                                  │
│      + PTO/Vacation: ______%                                │
│      + Taxes/Insurance: ______%                             │
│      + Benefits: ______%                                    │
│      = Fully-Loaded Rate: $XX.XX/hr (calculated)           │
│                                                             │
│  ○ Advanced (Soft Cost Calculator)                          │
│    Uses blended rate from employee roster calculation       │
│    [Open Calculator] → Current Rate: $XX.XX/hr             │
│                                                             │
│  ⚠️ Reference only - consult CFO/CPA for actual rates       │
│                                                             │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Database Fields (tenant_settings)
From electrical-estimating-config-formulas.md:

### Labor Burden Components
- base_hourly_wage DECIMAL (default 36.52)
- taxable_fringe_pct DECIMAL (default 6.73) -- PTO/vacation
- taxes_insurance_pct DECIMAL (default 19.14) -- Employer taxes
- nontaxable_fringe_pct DECIMAL (default 5.63) -- Benefits
- burdened_rate DECIMAL (computed or manual entry)
- labor_rate_method ENUM ('direct', 'components', 'calculator')

### Calculator Link
- calculator_blended_rate DECIMAL (from soft cost calculator)
- calculator_data_id UUID (FK to saved calculator state)

## Calculation
```
IF labor_rate_method = 'direct':
  effective_rate = burdened_rate (manual entry)
ELIF labor_rate_method = 'components':
  effective_rate = base_hourly_wage × (1 + taxable_fringe_pct + taxes_insurance_pct + nontaxable_fringe_pct)
ELIF labor_rate_method = 'calculator':
  effective_rate = calculator_blended_rate
```

## Files to Modify
- apps/api/migrations/043_labor_rate_settings.sql
- apps/web/src/components/Settings/CompanyPreferencesSettings.jsx
- apps/api/src/services/tenantSettings.service.js
close_reason: Implementation complete: migration 052, service layer, and UI component

title: Barcode and QR Code Scanning for Inventory
description:
## Overview
Implement barcode and QR code scanning capabilities for inventory management.

## Requirements
- Camera-based scanning (mobile and desktop webcam)
- Support for common barcode formats: UPC-A, UPC-E, EAN-13, Code 128, Code 39
- QR code support for internal inventory labels
- Scan to lookup: find inventory item by barcode/SKU
- Scan to add: add items to work orders, transfers, cycle counts
- Scan to receive: receive PO items by scanning
- Bulk scanning mode for multiple items
- Audio/haptic feedback on successful scan
- Manual entry fallback if scan fails

## Key Files
- apps/web/src/components/common/BarcodeScanner.jsx (CREATE)
- apps/web/src/hooks/useBarcodeScanner.js (CREATE)
- apps/api/src/services/barcodeLookup.service.js (CREATE)

## Integration Points
- Inventory item lookup by SKU/barcode
- Work order parts addition
- Inventory transfer scanning
- Cycle count scanning
- PO receiving

## Libraries
- Consider: @zxing/library, quagga2, or html5-qrcode

## Acceptance Criteria
- Scans UPC and QR codes reliably
- Works on mobile browsers (iOS Safari, Chrome)
- Instant lookup shows item details
- Can add scanned items to WO/transfer
- Handles 'not found' gracefully with manual entry option
close_reason: Implemented barcode/QR scanning: useBarcodeScanner hook, BarcodeScanner component, barcodeLookup.service.js, API endpoints POST/GET /inventory/scan. Supports UPC, EAN, Code128, Code39, QR codes with camera and manual entry fallback.

title: AI: Estimate to Work Order Conversion
description:
Convert accepted estimates to work orders using AI.

## Feature: estimate_to_workorder

## Workflow
1. User accepts estimate or marks as 'won'
2. AI analyzes estimate areas/line items
3. Generates work order with:
   - Task breakdown from cost items
   - Time estimates from labor hours
   - Material requirements from BOM
   - Suggested scheduling based on crew requirements

## AI Prompt Considerations
- Group tasks by area
- Sequence tasks logically (rough-in before trim-out)
- Flag items requiring LAB2+ for crew scheduling
- Suggest work order type based on estimate content

## API
- POST /api/ai/estimate-to-workorder
- Input: estimate_id
- Output: draft work order data (user reviews before saving)

## Dependencies
- Estimate must have areas and line items
- Cost items should have labor codes
close_reason: Feature already fully implemented. description:

## Features: smart_scheduling, schedule_optimization

  - Skills/certifications required
  - Current location/route

### schedule_optimization

  - Balance workload across technicians

- Consider traffic patterns by time of day
- Factor in job duration estimates from labor hours
- Handle emergency/urgent prioritization

- POST /api/ai/suggest-technician - Best tech for a WO
- POST /api/ai/optimize-schedule - Optimize day's schedule
- POST /api/ai/rebalance-routes - Rebalance after changes

## Data Needed
- Technician locations (GPS)
- Skill certifications
- Current schedule
- Work order requirements
- Historical job durations

title: Procurement: Estimate Pricing Review Workflow
description:
## Overview
Implement procurement workflow for reviewing and confirming estimate pricing before client delivery.

## Requirements
- Estimate pricing review queue (pending reviews)
- Review page showing each cost item line
- Attach products to cost item lines
- Confirm actual pricing based on products
- Show price variance (estimated vs confirmed)

- Finalize estimate for client delivery

## Key Files

- apps/api/src/services/estimateProcurementReview.service.js (CREATE)
- apps/api/src/routes/estimateProcurementReview.routes.js (CREATE)

## Workflow
1. Estimator submits estimate for review
2. Procurement sees estimate in queue
3. Procurement attaches products to each line
4. System calculates actual costs
5. Procurement confirms pricing
6. Estimate finalized for client

## Dependencies

## Acceptance Criteria
- Queue shows pending estimates

- Price variance calculated and shown

- Estimator notified of approval/changes

title: AI-Native: Universal Context-Aware Handler
description:
attached_molecule: co-wisp-2sa
attached_at: 2026-01-23T06:32:45Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Upgrade the AI chat to be fully context-aware and universal across all screens.

## Problem
Current AI chat asks for details instead of using existing data. User said 'add LED panels' but AI asked for SKU, price, etc. instead of searching cost items.

## Solution: Universal Handler with Context Injection

### Frontend Context Injection
Every AI request includes:
```javascript
{
  message: 'user input',
  context: {
    screen: 'inventory|estimate|workorder|customer|...',
    selectedRecord: { id, type, data },
    visibleRecords: [...],
    currentFilters: { ... },
    userPermissions: ['inventory.write', ...]
  }
}
```

### AI Behavior Changes
1. **Search before ask** - Always search existing records before requesting manual input
2. **Context-aware actions** - Use screen context to guide tool selection
3. **Cross-domain operations** - Handle 'add to estimate AND update inventory' in one conversation
4. **Record awareness** - Know what record is being viewed/edited

### Implementation Steps
1. Update frontend to send context with AI requests (AIChatPanel, EstimateAIChat, VoiceButton)
2. Update chat.service.js to use context for tool selection
3. Add cost item search to add_inventory_item flow
4. Add record lookup before any 'add' operation
5. Test: 'add LED panels to main office' should find cost item and use its data

### Files to Modify
- apps/web/src/components/AIChatPanel.jsx
- apps/web/src/components/rsb/EstimateAIChat.jsx
- apps/api/src/services/chat.service.js
- apps/api/src/services/ai/chatToolHandlers.js
- apps/api/src/routes/ai.routes.js

### Success Criteria
- User says 'add LED panels' → AI finds cost item → uses existing data
- User on estimate screen says 'add outlets' → AI adds to current estimate
- No manual data entry for items that exist in system
close_reason: Implemented universal context-aware handler with search-first behavior

title: Add document number sequences tables (Estimate, PO, WO)
description:
Create sequence tables for document numbering like invoice_number_sequences:

**Database Migration:**
Create tables with same structure as invoice_number_sequences (migration 060):

```sql
-- Estimate sequences
CREATE TABLE estimate_number_sequences (
  tenant_id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES tenants(id),
  prefix VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'EST-',
  next_number INTEGER DEFAULT 1001,
  padding INTEGER DEFAULT 5,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Purchase Order sequences  
CREATE TABLE po_number_sequences (
  tenant_id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES tenants(id),
  prefix VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'PO-',
  next_number INTEGER DEFAULT 1001,
  padding INTEGER DEFAULT 5,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Work Order sequences
CREATE TABLE wo_number_sequences (
  tenant_id UUID PRIMARY KEY REFERENCES tenants(id),
  prefix VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'WO-',
  next_number INTEGER DEFAULT 1001,
  padding INTEGER DEFAULT 5,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);
```

**Functions:**
- get_next_estimate_number(p_tenant_id UUID)
- get_next_po_number(p_tenant_id UUID)
- get_next_wo_number(p_tenant_id UUID)

**Backend Service:**
- Create documentSequences.service.js with CRUD for all sequence types
- GET/PATCH endpoints for each sequence type

**Reference:**
- Pattern from apps/api/migrations/060_accounting_integrations.sql lines 405-443

title: AI Usage Admin Dashboard
description:
Admin dashboard for monitoring AI usage, costs, and margins.

## Requirements
- Real-time usage monitoring across all tenants
- Cost vs revenue margin analysis
- Usage trends over time (daily/weekly/monthly)
- Top consumers by tenant/feature
- Alert when AI costs exceed threshold % of plan price
- Anthropic pricing management (update rates when they change)

## Data Sources (already built)
- v_ai_cost_margin_analysis view - per-tenant margin analysis
- get_ai_cost_summary() function - aggregate stats
- ai_provider_pricing table - Anthropic rate management
- mv_ai_usage_monthly materialized view - monthly aggregates

## Dashboard Components
1. Summary cards: Total calls, tokens, cost this month
2. Line chart: Usage trend over time
3. Pie chart: Usage by feature (suggest_labor vs invoice_ocr etc)
4. Table: Per-tenant breakdown with margin %
5. Alerts panel: Tenants exceeding cost thresholds
6. Pricing config: View/update Anthropic rates

## API Endpoints Needed
- GET /api/admin/ai/summary - Overall stats
- GET /api/admin/ai/by-tenant - Per-tenant breakdown
- GET /api/admin/ai/trends - Time series data
- GET /api/admin/ai/pricing - Current Anthropic rates
- PUT /api/admin/ai/pricing - Update rates

title: Estimate Editor: File Upload Backend
description:
Create backend for estimate file uploads.

**Database Migration (071_estimate_files.sql):**
```sql
CREATE TABLE estimate_files (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  tenant_id UUID REFERENCES tenants(id),
  estimate_id UUID REFERENCES estimates(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  area_id UUID REFERENCES estimate_areas(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
  file_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  file_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  file_size INTEGER,
  file_url TEXT NOT NULL,
  upload_type VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'file', -- 'file' or 'drawing'
  uploaded_by UUID REFERENCES users(id),
  uploaded_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_estimate_files_estimate ON estimate_files(estimate_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_estimate_files_area ON estimate_files(area_id);
```

**API Endpoints:**
- POST /api/estimates/:id/files - Upload file (multipart)
- GET /api/estimates/:id/files - List files for estimate
- DELETE /api/estimates/:id/files/:fileId - Delete file

title: AI: Procurement Invoice OCR & Inventory
description:
AI-powered invoice processing with OCR and inventory management.

## Features: invoice_ocr, invoice_processing, inventory_matching, po_reconciliation, cost_averaging

## Workflow

### 1. Invoice OCR (invoice_ocr)
- Upload scanned invoice image/PDF
- Claude Vision extracts:
  - Vendor name and info
  - Invoice number and date
  - Line items (description, qty, unit price, total)
  - Tax, shipping, total
- Returns structured JSON

### 2. Invoice Processing (invoice_processing)
- Parse OCR output into inventory transactions
- Validate totals match
- Flag discrepancies for review

### 3. Inventory Matching (inventory_matching)
- Match invoice line items to existing inventory SKUs
- Fuzzy matching for vendor part numbers
- Suggest new SKU creation for unknown items
- Handle unit of measure conversions

### 4. PO Reconciliation (po_reconciliation)
- Match invoice to open purchase orders
- Flag quantity/price discrepancies
- Support partial receipts
- Track backorders

### 5. Cost Averaging (cost_averaging)
- Calculate weighted average cost:
  existing_qty * existing_cost + new_qty * new_cost / total_qty
- Update inventory item cost
- Track cost history for reporting

## API
- POST /api/ai/invoice-ocr - Upload and extract invoice
- POST /api/ai/match-invoice-items - Match to inventory
- POST /api/ai/reconcile-po - Match to PO
- GET /api/inventory/:id/cost-history - View cost changes

## Reports
- When was item X last received?
- What was the price history?
- Average cost over time
- Vendor price comparison

## Token Usage
- Invoice OCR uses Claude Vision: ~10-20K tokens per image
- Pro plan has 2M tokens/month to accommodate

(Moved from ms-jdc4)
close_reason: Invoice OCR feature implemented with Claude Vision - extraction, inventory matching, PO reconciliation, and cost averaging

title: Refinery: Update mayor/rig working tree after merge
description:
## Problem

When the refinery merges a polecat's branch into main, it updates git refs (HEAD moves to new commit) but does NOT update the working tree files in `mayor/rig`. This causes:

1. Files show as "deleted" or "modified" in `git status` (working tree diverges from HEAD)
2. New files from merged commits don't appear on disk
3. Web/API servers running from `mayor/rig` don't see the merged changes
4. Manual intervention required: `git checkout -- .` to sync

## Root Cause

Git merge operations update the repository state (commits, branches) but don't automatically checkout files to the working directory when done from another location or via bare operations.

## Observed Impact

- Estimate UI changes merged but not visible in running app
- Migration files missing from disk despite being in HEAD
- Required manual `git checkout -- .` to restore files

## Proposed Fix

After refinery completes a merge to main, it should:

```bash
# In mayor/rig after merge
git checkout -- .
# Or more safely:
git reset --hard HEAD
```

## Files to Modify

- Gas Town refinery merge logic (wherever merge completion is handled)
- Possibly add post-merge hook to mayor/rig

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] After refinery merge, `git status` in mayor/rig shows clean working tree
- [ ] New/modified files from merge are present on disk
- [ ] Running dev servers see changes without manual intervention
